thread.title: Seattle Seahawks re-sign WR B.J. Daniels to take place of suspended Derrick Coleman
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks re-sign WR B.J. Daniels to take place of suspended Derrick Coleman | The Seattle Times

author: Bob Condotta
title: Seattle Seahawks re-sign WR B.J. Daniels to take place of suspended Derrick Coleman
text:
The Seattle Seahawks Thursday re-signed receiver B.J.Daniels to the team’s 53-man roster to take the spot of the suspended Derrick Coleman.
Coleman was indefinitely suspended by the Seahawks earlier in the day after being arrested on investigation of vehicular assault and hit and run. Coleman is being held without bail, as is common until he appears before a judge for a bail hearing.
Daniels was released earlier in the week as the team made room for cornerback Crezdon Butler and linebacker Nick Moody, who were each signed to fill spots where the team has had injury issues.
Related Stories Live: Bellevue PD addresses Seahawks FB Derrick Coleman's arrest for alleged hit-and-run Russell Wilson and Macklemore star in latest Bose headphones commercial Seattle Seahawks-Carolina Panthers referee: Terry McAulay Tom Brady on Deflategate, Gisele and Trump Seattle Seahawks offensive coordinator Darrell Bevell on Russell Wilson, the offensive line and more Seattle Seahawks' Richard Sherman: 'One game doesn’t define you, and you keep fighting' The team put Coleman on a suspended list and he can be returned to the 53-man roster at any time, though a player would have to be waived or released to make room.
Daniels, a former quarterback, has one reception for 12 yards this season and also has seen time on special teams the last two weeks.
Daniels was in the locker room before practice Thursday and taking part in practice.
 
Bob Condotta : 206-515-5699 or bcondotta@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @bobcondotta . Bob Condotta covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He provides daily coverage of the team throughout the year.
